intro: Exacum arabicum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a contrasting central spot. Its leaves are typically velvety and dark green, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Exacum arabicum is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its long-lasting blooms.
